description: Add Foursquare venue and user information to your app.
steps: Create a new Foursquare Application, by going to https://foursquare.com/developers/register
Copy and save your clientId, clientSecret, redirectUrl
If the user accepts, they will be redirected back to http://YOUR_REGISTERED_REDIRECT_URI/?code=code
Use getAccessToken method to get users's accessToken.

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Access tokens allow apps to make requests to Foursquare on the behalf of a user. Each access token is unique to the user and consumer key.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: code
args.info: The authorization code.

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: Application redirect url.

blocks.name: getUser
blocks.description: Returns profile information for a given user, including selected mayorships.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: userId
args.info: Identity of the user to get details for. Pass `self` to get details of the acting user.

blocks.name: getPendingFriendRequests
blocks.description: Shows a user the list of users with whom they have a pending friend request (i.e., someone tried to add the acting user as a friend, but the acting user has not accepted).

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

blocks.name: findUsers
blocks.description: Helps a user locate friends.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: phone
args.info: A comma-delimited list of phone numbers to look for.

args.name: email
args.info: A comma-delimited list of email addresses to look for.

args.name: twitter
args.info: A comma-delimited list of Twitter handles to look for.

args.name: twitterSource
args.info: A single Twitter handle. Results will be users that this handle follows on Twitter who use Foursquare.

args.name: facebookIds
args.info: A comma-delimited list of Facebook ID's to look for.

args.name: name
args.info: A single string to search for in users' names.

args.name: onlyPages
args.info: (default false) Indicates whether to only return pages. This replaces the functionality of the old dedicated pages/search endpoint.

blocks.name: getUserVisitedVenues
blocks.description: Returns a list of all venues visited by the specified user, along with how many visits and when they were last there.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: userId
args.info: For now, only `self` is supported.

args.name: beforeTimestamp
args.info: Seconds since epoch.

args.name: afterTimestamp
args.info: Seconds after epoch.

args.name: categoryId
args.info: Limits returned venues to those in this category. If specifying a top-level category, all sub-categories will also match the query.

blocks.name: getUserPhotos
blocks.description: Returns photos from a user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: userId
args.info: User ID to retrieve photos for.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 500.

args.name: offset
args.info: Used to page through results.

blocks.name: getUserCheckins
blocks.description: Returns a history of checkins for the authenticated user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: userId
args.info: For now, only `self` is supported

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 250.

args.name: offset
args.info: The number of results to skip. Used to page through results.

args.name: sort
args.info: How to sort the returned checkins. Can be `newestfirst` or `oldestfirst`.

args.name: afterTimestamp
args.info: Retrieve the first results to follow these seconds since epoch. This should be useful for paging forward in time, or when polling for changes. To avoid missing results when polling, we recommend subtracting several seconds from the last poll time and then de-duplicating.

args.name: beforeTimestamp
args.info: Retrieve the first results prior to these seconds since epoch. Useful for paging backward in time.

blocks.name: getUserLikedVenues
blocks.description: Returns a list of venues liked by the specified user

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: userId
args.info: User ID or `self`

args.name: beforeTimestamp
args.info: Seconds since epoch.

args.name: afterTimestamp
args.info: Seconds after epoch.

args.name: categoryId
args.info: Limits returned venues to those in this category. If specifying a top-level category, all sub-categories will also match the query.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return.

args.name: offset
args.info: Used to page through results.

blocks.name: getUserMayorships
blocks.description: Returns a user's mayorships.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: userId
args.info: Identity of the user to get mayorships for. Pass `self` to get friends of the acting user.

blocks.name: getUserLists
blocks.description: A User's Lists.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: userId
args.info: Identity of the user to get lists for. Pass `self` to get lists of the acting user.

args.name: group
args.info: Can be `created` (lists created by this user), `edited` (other people's lists this user has edited), `followed` (lists this user follows), `friends` (lists from this user's friends), and `suggested` (lists relevant to the user's current location).

args.name: location
args.info: Location of the user, required in order to receive the suggested group. Format: `lat,lng`. Example: `40.7,-74`

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 200.

args.name: offset
args.info: The number of results to skip. Used to page through results.

blocks.name: updateUserPhoto
blocks.description: Updates the user's profile photo.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: photo
args.info: Photo under `100KB` in multipart MIME encoding with content type `image/jpeg`, `image/gif`, or `image/png`.

blocks.name: getUserFriends
blocks.description: Returns an array of a user's friends.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: userId
args.info: Identity of the user to get friends of. Pass `self` to get friends of the acting user.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 500.

args.name: offset
args.info: Used to page through results.

blocks.name: getSingleVenue
blocks.description: Gives details about a venue, including location, mayorship, tags, tips, specials, and category.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: venueId
args.info: ID of venue to retrieve

blocks.name: searchVenues
blocks.description: Returns a list of venues near the current location, optionally matching a search term.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: location
args.info: Required unless near is provided: Latitude and longitude of the user's location. Format: `lat,lng`. Example: `40.7,-74`

args.name: near
args.info: Required unless location is provided:  A string naming a place in the world. If the near string is not geocodable, returns a failed_geocode error. Otherwise, searches within the bounds of the geocode. Adds a geocode object to the response. (Required for query searches)

args.name: locationAccuracy
args.info: Accuracy of latitude and longitude, in meters. (Does not currently affect search results.)

args.name: altitude
args.info: Altitude of the user's location, in meters. (Does not currently affect search results.)

args.name: altitudeAccuracy
args.info: Accuracy of the user's altitude, in meters. (Does not currently affect search results.)

args.name: query
args.info: A search term to be applied against venue names.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 50.

args.name: intent
args.info: One of the values below, indicating your intent in performing the search. If no value is specified, defaults to `checkin`. See README for more info.

args.name: radius
args.info: Limit results to venues within this many meters of the specified location. Defaults to a city-wide area. Only valid for requests with intent=browse, or requests with intent=checkin and categoryId or query. Does not apply to match intent requests. The maximum supported radius is currently 100,000 meters.

args.name: southWest
args.info: Example: `44.3,37.2`. With northEast, limits results to the bounding quadrangle defined by the latitude and longitude given by sw as its south-west corner, and ne as its north-east corner. The bounding quadrangle is only supported for intent=browse searches. Not valid with ll or radius. Bounding quadrangles with an area up to approximately 10,000 square kilometers are supported.

args.name: northEast
args.info: See `southWest`.

args.name: categoryId
args.info: A comma separated list of categories to limit results to. If you specify categoryId specifying a radius may improve results. If specifying a top-level category, all sub-categories will also match the query. Does not apply to match intent requests.

args.name: url
args.info: A third-party URL which we will attempt to match against our map of venues to URLs.

args.name: providerId
args.info: Identifier for a known third party that is part of our map of venues to URLs, used in conjunction with `linkedId`.

args.name: linkedId
args.info: 1002207971611 Identifier used by third party specified in `providerId`, which we will attempt to match against our map of venues to URLs.

blocks.name: getSuggestedCompletion
blocks.description: Returns a list of mini-venues partially matching the search term, near the location.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: query
args.info: A search term to be applied against titles. Must be at least 3 characters long.

args.name: location
args.info: Required unless near is provided: Latitude and longitude of the user's location. Format: `lat,lng`. Example: `40.7,-74`

args.name: near
args.info: Required unless location is provided:  A string naming a place in the world. If the near string is not geocodable, returns a failed_geocode error. Otherwise, searches within the bounds of the geocode. Adds a geocode object to the response. (Required for query searches)

args.name: locationAccuracy
args.info: Accuracy of latitude and longitude, in meters. (Does not currently affect search results.)

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 100.

args.name: radius
args.info: Limit results to venues within this many meters of the specified location. Defaults to a city-wide area. The maximum supported radius is currently 80,000 meters.

args.name: southWest
args.info: Example: `44.3,37.2`. With northEast, limits results to the bounding quadrangle defined by the latitude and longitude given by sw as its south-west corner, and ne as its north-east corner. The bounding quadrangle is only supported for intent=browse searches. Not valid with ll or radius. Bounding quadrangles with an area up to approximately 10,000 square kilometers are supported.

args.name: northEast
args.info: See `southWest`.

blocks.name: getVenueCategories
blocks.description: Returns a hierarchical list of categories applied to venues.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

blocks.name: getTrendingVenues
blocks.description: Returns a list of venues near the current location with the most people currently checked in.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: location
args.info: Location of the user. Format: `lat,lng`. Example: `40.7,-74`

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 50.

args.name: radius
args.info: Radius in meters, up to approximately 2000 meters.

blocks.name: getRecommendedVenues
blocks.description: Returns a list of recommended venues near the current location.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: location
args.info: Required unless near is provided: Latitude and longitude of the user's location. Format: `lat,lng`. Example: `40.7,-74`

args.name: near
args.info: Required unless location is provided:  A string naming a place in the world. If the near string is not geocodable, returns a failed_geocode error. Otherwise, searches within the bounds of the geocode. Adds a geocode object to the response. (Required for query searches)

args.name: locationAccuracy
args.info: Accuracy of latitude and longitude, in meters. (Does not currently affect search results.)

args.name: altitude
args.info: Altitude of the user's location, in meters. (Does not currently affect search results.)

args.name: altitudeAccuracy
args.info: Accuracy of the user's altitude, in meters. (Does not currently affect search results.)

args.name: query
args.info: A search term to be applied against venue names.

args.name: radius
args.info: Radius to search within, in meters. If radius is not specified, a suggested radius will be used based on the density of venues in the area.

args.name: section
args.info: One of `food`, `drinks`, `coffee`, `shops`, `arts`, `outdoors`, `sights`, `trending` or `specials`, `nextVenues` (venues frequently visited after a given venue), or topPicks (a mix of recommendations generated without a query from the user). Choosing one of these limits results to venues with the specified category or property.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 50.

args.name: offset
args.info: Used to page through results.

args.name: novelty
args.info: Pass `new `or `old` to limit results to places the acting user hasn't been or has been, respectively. Omitting this parameter returns a mixture of old and new venues.

args.name: friendVisits
args.info: Pass `visited` or `notvisited` to limit results to places the acting user's friends have or haven't been, respectively. Omitting this parameter returns a mixture of venues to which the user's friends have or haven't been.

args.name: time
args.info: Pass `any` to retrieve results for any time of day. Omitting this parameter returns results targeted to the current time of day.

args.name: day
args.info: Pass `any` to retrieve results for any day of the week. Omitting this parameter returns results targeted to the current day of the week.

args.name: venuePhotos
args.info: Boolean flag to include a photo in the response for each venue, if one is available. Default is `0` (no photos). Photos are returned as part of the venue JSON object.

args.name: lastVenue
args.info: A venue ID to use in combination with the intent=nextVenues parameter, which returns venues users often visit after a given venue. If intent=nextVenues is specified but lastVenue is not, the user's last check-in will be used if it is within 2 hours. If the user has not checked in within the last 2 hours, no results will be returned.

args.name: openNow
args.info: Boolean flag to only include venues that are open now. This prefers official provider hours but falls back to popular check-in hours.

args.name: sortByDistance
args.info: Boolean flag to sort the results by distance instead of relevance. Example: `1`

args.name: price
args.info: Comma separated list of price points. Currently the valid range of price points are [1,2,3,4], 1 being the least expensive, 4 being the most expensive. For food venues, in the United States, 1 is < $10 an entree, 2 is $10-$20 an entree, 3 is $20-$30 an entree, 4 is > $30 an entree.

args.name: saved
args.info: Boolean flag to only include venues that the user has saved on their To-Do list or to another list.

args.name: specials
args.info: Boolean flag to only include venues that have a special.

blocks.name: addVenue
blocks.description: Allows Foursquare users to add a new venue.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: name
args.info: the name of the venue

args.name: address
args.info: The address of the venue.

args.name: crossStreet
args.info: The nearest intersecting street or streets.

args.name: city
args.info: The city name where this venue is.

args.name: state
args.info: The nearest state or province to the venue.

args.name: zip
args.info: The zip or postal code for the venue.

args.name: phone
args.info: The phone number of the venue.

args.name: twitter
args.info: The twitter handle of the venue.

args.name: location
args.info: Latitude and longitude of the venue, as accurate as is known. Format: `lat,lng`. Example: `40.7,-74`

args.name: primaryCategoryId
args.info: The ID of the category to which you want to assign this venue.

args.name: description
args.info: A freeform description of the venue, up to 160 characters.

args.name: url
args.info: The url of the homepage of the venue.

args.name: ignoreDuplicates
args.info: A boolean flag telling the server to ignore duplicates and force the addition of this venue.

args.name: ignoreDuplicatesKey
args.info: Required if ignoreDuplicates is true. This key will be available in the response of the HTTP 409 error of the first (failed) attempt to add venue.

blocks.name: getUserManagedVenues
blocks.description: Get a list of venues the current user manages.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of managed venues to return. Defaults to 100, maximum is 1000.

args.name: offset
args.info: Number of venues to skip over for paging. Defaults to 0.

blocks.name: getSimilarVenues
blocks.description: Returns a list of venues similar to the specified venue.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue you want similar venues for.

blocks.name: getVenuePhotos
blocks.description: Returns photos for a venue.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue id for which photos are being requested.

args.name: group
args.info: If not specified, public venue photos are returned ordered by relevance. Pass venue for public venue photos, ordered by recency. Pass checkin for venue photos from friends (including non-public photos from recent checkins), ordered by recency. See our documentation on photos for information on how to handle the response and construct actual photo URLs.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 200.

args.name: offset
args.info: Used to page through results.

blocks.name: getVenueEvents
blocks.description: Allows you to access information about the current events at a place.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue id for which events are being requested.

blocks.name: getUsersWhoLikedVenue
blocks.description: Returns friends and a total count of users who have liked this venue.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The ID of the venue to get likes for.

blocks.name: getNextVenues
blocks.description: Returns venues that people often check in to after the current venue. Up to 5 venues are returned in each query, and results are sorted by how many people have visited that venue after the current one. Homes are never returned in results.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: venueId
args.info: ID of the venue you want to see next venue information about

blocks.name: getVenueHours
blocks.description: Returns hours for a venue.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue id for which hours are being requested.

blocks.name: getVenueLinks
blocks.description: Returns URLs or identifiers from third parties that have been applied to this venue, such as how the New York Times refers to this venue and a URL for additional information from nytimes.com. This is part of the foursquare Venue Map.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue you want annotations for.

blocks.name: getVenueMenu
blocks.description: Returns menu information for a venue.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue id for which menu is being requested.

blocks.name: getVenueTips
blocks.description: Returns tips for a venue.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue you want tips for.

args.name: sort
args.info: One of `friends`, `recent`, or `popular`.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 500.

args.name: offset
args.info: Used to page through results.

blocks.name: getVenuePeopleCount
blocks.description: Provides a count of how many people are at a given venue.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: venueId
args.info: ID of venue to retrieve

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 500.

args.name: offset
args.info: Used to page through results.

blocks.name: claimVenue
blocks.description: Claim a venue for the user. If your OAuth Consumer is set up with the proper privileges, you can use this endpoint to claim a venue on behalf of a user without the claim having to be approved by foursquare staff.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: visible
args.info: (optional, default `true`) whether role as manager is visible on the venue page

blocks.name: dislikeVenue
blocks.description: Allows the acting user to dislike for a venue.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue to dislike for

blocks.name: undoDislikeVenue
blocks.description: Allows the acting user to undo a previous dislike for a venue.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue to undo a dislike for

blocks.name: flagVenue
blocks.description: Allows users to indicate a venue is incorrect in some way.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue id for which an edit is being proposed.

args.name: problem
args.info: One of `mislocated`, `closed`, `duplicate`, `inappropriate`, `doesnt_exist`, `event_over`

args.name: dublicatedVenue
args.info: ID of the duplicated venue (for problem `duplicate`)

blocks.name: proposeVenueChange
blocks.description: If the user knows the correct venue information, use this method to save it. Otherwise, use flag to flag the venue instead (you need not specify new venue info in that case).

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue id for which an edit is being proposed.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the venue.

args.name: address
args.info: The address of the venue.

args.name: crossStreet
args.info: The nearest intersecting street or streets.

args.name: city
args.info: The city name where this venue is.

args.name: state
args.info: The nearest state or province to the venue.

args.name: zip
args.info: The zip or postal code for the venue.

args.name: phone
args.info: The phone number of the venue.

args.name: twitter
args.info: The twitter handle of the venue.

args.name: description
args.info: A freeform description of the venue, up to 300 characters.

args.name: url
args.info: The url of the homepage of the venue.

args.name: menuUrl
args.info: A url where the menu of the venue can be found.

args.name: facebookUrl
args.info: The url for this venue's Facebook Page.

args.name: venueLocation
args.info: Latitude and longitude at which the venue should be located. Example: `44.3,37.2`

args.name: primaryCategoryId
args.info: The ID of the category to which you want to assign this venue.

args.name: addCategoryIds
args.info: Comma-separated list of new category IDs to be assigned to this venue. If you are adding a new category to a venue and you want to make it primary, you should just use primaryCategoryId.

args.name: removeCategoryIds
args.info: Comma-separated list of new category IDs to be removed from this venue.

args.name: hours
args.info: The hours for the venue, as a semi-colon separated list of open segments and named segments (e.g., brunch or happy hour). Open segments are formatted as day,start,end. Named segments additionally have a label, formatted as day,start,end,label. Days are formatted as integers with Monday = 1,...,Sunday = 7. Start and End are formatted as [+]HHMM format. Use 24 hour format (no colon), prefix with 0 for HH or MM less than 10. Use '+' prefix, i.e., +0230 to represent 2:30 am past midnight into the following day.

blocks.name: likeVenue
blocks.description: Allows the acting user to like a venue.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue to like

blocks.name: unlikeVenue
blocks.description: Allows the acting user to unlike a venue.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue to unlike

blocks.name: getVenueGroups
blocks.description: List all venue groups owned by the user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

blocks.name: getCheckin
blocks.description: Get details of a check-in.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: checkinId
args.info: The ID of the check-in to retrieve additional information for.

blocks.name: resolvePublicCheckinFromUrl
blocks.description: Check-ins that are posted to public feeds such as Twitter do not reveal the associated check-in's ID. Use this endpoint to map from a check-in URL (e.g., https://www.swarmapp.com/c/fcP5m3yn7AL) to check-in details.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: shortId
args.info: The short ID at the end of a swarmapp.com link, e.g., https://swarmapp.com/c/abc123ZYX

blocks.name: getRecentFriendsCheckins
blocks.description: Returns a list of recent checkins from friends.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: location
args.info: Latitude and longitude of the user's location, so response can include distance. Format: `lat,lng`. Example: `40.7,-74`

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 100.

args.name: afterTimestamp
args.info: Seconds after which to look for checkins, e.g. for looking for new checkins since the last fetch. If more than limit results are new since then, this is ignored. Checkins created prior to this timestamp will still be returned if they have new comments or photos, making it easier to poll for all new activity.

blocks.name: createCheckin
blocks.description: Allows you to check in to a place.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue where the user is checking in. Find venue IDs by searching or from historical APIs.

args.name: eventId
args.info: The event the user is checking in to.

args.name: shout
args.info: A message about your check-in. The maximum length of this field is 140 characters.

args.name: mentions
args.info: Mentions in your check-in. This parameter is a semicolon-delimited list of mentions. A single mention is of the form `start,end,userid`, where start is the index of the first character in the shout representing the mention, end is the index of the first character in the shout after the mention, and userid is the userid of the user being mentioned. If userid is prefixed with 'fbu-', this indicates a Facebook userid that is being mention. Character indices in shouts are 0-based.

args.name: broadcast
args.info: Who to broadcast this check-in to. Accepts a comma-delimited list of values: `private`, `public`, `facebook`, `twitter`, `followers`

args.name: location
args.info: Latitude and longitude of the user's location. Only specify this field if you have a GPS or other device reported location for the user at the time of check-in. Format: `lat,lng`. Example: `40.7,-74`

args.name: locationAccuracy
args.info: Accuracy of latitude and longitude, in meters.

args.name: altitude
args.info: Altitude of the user's location, in meters.

args.name: altitudeAccuracy
args.info: Accuracy of the user's altitude, in meters.

blocks.name: getUsersWhoLikedCheckin
blocks.description: Returns friends and a total count of users who have liked this checkin.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: checkinId
args.info: The ID of the checkin to get likes for.

blocks.name: removeCommentFromCheckin
blocks.description: Remove a comment from a checkin, if the acting user is the author or the owner of the checkin.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: checkinId
args.info: The ID of the checkin to remove a comment from.

args.name: commentId
args.info: The id of the comment to remove.

blocks.name: likeCheckin
blocks.description: Allows the acting user to like a checkin.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: checkinId
args.info: Checking id to like

blocks.name: unlikeCheckin
blocks.description: Allows the acting user to unlike a checkin.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: checkinId
args.info: Checking id to unlike

blocks.name: addPostToCheckin
blocks.description: Post user generated content from an external app to a check-in. This post will be accessible to anyone who can view the details of the check-in.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: checkinId
args.info: The ID of the checkin to add a post to.

args.name: text
args.info: The text of the post, up to 200 characters.

args.name: url
args.info: Link for more details. This page will be opened in an embedded web view in the foursquare application, unless contentId is specified and a native link handler is registered and present. We support the following URL schemes: http, https, foursquare, mailto, tel, and sms.

args.name: contentId
args.info: Identifier for the post to be used in a native link, up to 50 characters. A url must also be specified in the request.

blocks.name: addCommentToCheckin
blocks.description: Comment on a checkin-in

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: checkinId
args.info: The ID of the checkin to add a comment to.

args.name: text
args.info: The text of the comment, up to 200 characters.

args.name: mentions
args.info: Mentions in your check-in. This parameter is a semicolon-delimited list of mentions. A single mention is of the form `start,end,userid`, where start is the index of the first character in the shout representing the mention, end is the index of the first character in the shout after the mention, and userid is the userid of the user being mentioned. Character indices in shouts are 0-based.

blocks.name: getTip
blocks.description: Gives details about a tip, including which users (especially friends) have marked the tip to-do.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: tipId
args.info: ID of tip to retrieve

blocks.name: addTip
blocks.description: Allows you to add a new tip at a venue.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: venueId
args.info: The venue where you want to add this tip.

args.name: text
args.info: The text of the tip, up to 200 characters.

args.name: url
args.info: A URL related to this tip.

args.name: broadcast
args.info: Whether to broadcast this tip. Send twitter if you want to send to twitter, facebook if you want to send to facebook, or twitter,facebook if you want to send to both.

blocks.name: getUsersWhoLikedTip
blocks.description: Returns friends and a total count of users who have liked this tip.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: tipId
args.info: The ID of the tip to get likes for.

blocks.name: getUsersSavedTip
blocks.description: Returns friends and a total count of users who have saved this tip.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: tipId
args.info: The ID of the tip to get saves for.

blocks.name: getListsTipAppears
blocks.description: The lists that this tip appears on.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: tipId
args.info: Identity of a tip to get lists for.

args.name: group
args.info: can be `created`, `edited`, `followed`, `friends`, `other`. If no acting user is present, only other is supported.

blocks.name: removeTipFromToDoList
blocks.description: Allows you to remove a tip from your to-do list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: tipId
args.info: The tip you want to unmark.

blocks.name: flagTip
blocks.description: Allows the acting user to flag a tip as offensive, spam, or not relevant.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: tipId
args.info: The tip to flag.

args.name: comment
args.info: A comment explaining the flag.

args.name: problem
args.info: The specific problem with the tip. Must be one of `offensive`, `spam`, or `nolongerrelevant`.

blocks.name: likeTip
blocks.description: Allows the acting user to like a tip.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: tipId
args.info: The tip to like.

blocks.name: unlikeTip
blocks.description: Allows the acting user to like a tip.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: tipId
args.info: The tip to unlike.

blocks.name: getSingleList
blocks.description: Gives details about a list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: listId
args.info: Id for a user-created (e.g. /v2/lists/12381902N) or followed list or one of either USER_ID/tips (e.g. /v2/lists/32/tips) or USER_ID/todos.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 200.

args.name: offset
args.info: The number of results to skip. Used to page through results.

args.name: locationBounds
args.info: The number of results to skip. Used to page through results. Example: `30.13800,-98.16009,30.40485,-97.28118`

args.name: categoryId
args.info: Restricts the returned results to venues matching the input category id.

args.name: sort
args.info: Sorts the list items. Possible values are recent and nearby. recent sorts the list items by the date added to the list. nearby sorts the list items by the distance from the center of the provided llBounds.

blocks.name: addList
blocks.description: Allows users to create a new list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: name
args.info: Required The name of the list.

args.name: description
args.info: The description of the list.

args.name: collaborative
args.info: Boolean indicating if this list can be edited by friends.

args.name: photoId
args.info: The id of a photo that should be set as the list photo.

blocks.name: getListFollowers
blocks.description: Returns a count and items of users following this list.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: listId
args.info: Id for a user-created list

blocks.name: suggestItemListPhotos
blocks.description: Suggests photos that may be appropriate for this item.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: listId
args.info: Id for a user-created list.

args.name: itemId
args.info: Id of item on this list.

blocks.name: suggestListTips
blocks.description: Suggests tips that may be appropriate for this item.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: listId
args.info: Id for a user-created list.

args.name: itemId
args.info: Id of item.

blocks.name: getListItem
blocks.description: Gives details about a list item

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: listId
args.info: Id for a user-created or followed list.

args.name: itemId
args.info: Id for an item in the parent list.

blocks.name: suggestVenuesForList
blocks.description: Suggests venues that may be appropriate for this list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: listId
args.info: Id for a user-created list

blocks.name: updatesList
blocks.description: Allows you to update a list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: listId
args.info: Id for a user-created list.

args.name: name
args.info: If present and a non-empty value, updates the List name.

args.name: description
args.info: If present and a non-empty value, updates the List description. If present and empty, will remove the List description.

args.name: collaborative
args.info: Boolean indicating if this list can be edited by friends. Once this has been set to true for a list, authenticated friends can edit the list via additem, deleteitem, etc.

args.name: photoId
args.info: If present and a non-empty value, updates the List photo. If present and empty, will remove the List photo.

blocks.name: deleteItemFromList
blocks.description: Allows you to delete items from a list. One of itemId, venueId, or tipId must be provided.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: listId
args.info: Id for a user-created or followed list or one of either USER_ID/tips or USER_ID/todos.

args.name: itemId
args.info: Id of the item to delete.

args.name: venueId
args.info: Id of a venue to be deleted. If the venue is on the list multiple times, e.g. multiple tips at the same venue, all items will be removed.

args.name: tipId
args.info: Id of a tip to be deleted.

blocks.name: updateListItem
blocks.description:
Allows you to add or remove photos and tips from items on user-created lists. 
*Note:* Only valid on user-created lists 
*Note:* Collaborators can only update items they added. List owners can not update any item.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: listId
args.info: Id for a user-created list.

args.name: itemId
args.info: Id of the item to update.

args.name: tipId
args.info: If present and a non-empty value, adds or replaces a tip on this item. If present and empty, will remove the tip on this item.

args.name: text
args.info: If present creates a public tip on the venue and replaces any existing tip on the item. Cannot be used in conjuction with tipId or photoId

args.name: url
args.info: If adding a new tip via text, this can associate a url with the tip.

args.name: photoId
args.info: If present and a non-empty value, adds a photo to this item. If present and empty, will remove the photo on this item. If the photo was a private checkin photo, it will be promoted to a public venue photo.

blocks.name: followList
blocks.description: Allows you to follow a list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: listId
args.info: Id of a user-created list.

blocks.name: unfollowList
blocks.description: Allows you to unfollow a list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: listId
args.info: Id of a user-created list.

blocks.name: moveItemOnList
blocks.description: Allows you to move an item on a list. One of beforeId or afterId must be specified.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: listId
args.info: Id of a user-created list.

args.name: itemId
args.info: Id of the item on this list to move.

args.name: beforeId
args.info: Move `itemId` before `beforeId`.

args.name: afterId
args.info: Move `itemId` after `afterId`.

blocks.name: shareList
blocks.description: Share a user-created list to twitter or facebook.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: listId
args.info: List id to share.

args.name: broadcast
args.info: Where to broadcast this list. Send `twitter` if you want to send to twitter, `facebook` if you want to send to facebook, or `twitter,facebook` if you want to send to both.

args.name: message
args.info: A personal note to include with the share.

blocks.name: addItemToList
blocks.description: Allows you to add an item to a list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: followedListId
args.info: Id for a user-created or followed list as well as one of either USER_ID/tips or USER_ID/todos.

args.name: venueId
args.info: A venue to add to the list.

args.name: url
args.info: If adding a new tip via text, this can associate a url with the tip.

args.name: tipId
args.info: Used to add a tip to a list. Cannot be used in conjunction with the text and url fields.

args.name: listId
args.info: Used in conjuction with itemId, the id for a user created or followed list as well as one of either USER_ID/tips or USER_ID/todos.

args.name: itemId
args.info: Used in conjuction with listId, the id of an item on that list that we wish to copy to this list.

blocks.name: getUpdateDetails
blocks.description: Allows you to retrieve update details.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: updateId
args.info: The ID of the update to retrieve

blocks.name: getNotificationUpdates
blocks.description: Retrieve a user's notification tray notifications

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: limit
args.info: Maximum number of results to return, up to 99. Notifications are grouped over time, so there will usually be fewer than 99 results available at any given time. offset 0 Used to page through results. Only the 99 most recent notifications are visible, so offset must be no more than 99 - limit.

blocks.name: markNotificationsAsRead
blocks.description: Mark notification tray notifications as read up, to a certain timestamp.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: highWatermark
args.info: The timestamp of the most recent notification that the user viewed.

blocks.name: getPhoto
blocks.description: Get details of a photo.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: photoId
args.info: The ID of the photo to retrieve additional information for.

blocks.name: getSingleSetting
blocks.description: Returns a setting for the acting user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: settingId
args.info: The name of a setting.

blocks.name: getUserSettings
blocks.description: Returns the settings of the acting user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

blocks.name: changeSingleSetting
blocks.description: Change a setting for the given user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: settingId
args.info: Name of setting to change, sendMayorshipsToTwitter, sendBadgesToTwitter, sendMayorshipsToFacebook, sendBadgesToFacebook, receivePings, receiveCommentPings.

args.name: value
args.info: true, or false.

blocks.name: searchSpecials
blocks.description: Returns a list of specials near the current location.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: location
args.info: Latitude and longitude to search near. Format: `lat,lng`. Example: `40.7,-74`

args.name: radius
args.info: Limit results to venues within this many meters of the specified location. Defaults to a city-wide area.

args.name: locationAccuracy
args.info: Accuracy of latitude and longitude, in meters.

args.name: altitude
args.info: Altitude of the user's location, in meters.

args.name: altitudeAccuracy
args.info: Accuracy of the user's altitude, in meters.

args.name: limit
args.info: Number of results to return, up to 50.

blocks.name: getSingleEvent
blocks.description: Get details of a event.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: eventId
args.info: The ID of the event to retrieve additional information for.

blocks.name: searchEvents
blocks.description: This is an experimental API and subject to change or breakage.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: domain
args.info: Identifier for a known third-party event provider. This is used in conjunction with id. Currently songkick.com is the only supported value.

args.name: eventId
args.info: Identifier used by third-party specifed in domain, which we will attempt to match against our events listings. eventId is the id of an event, participantId is the id of a participant, like a band or sports team.

args.name: participantId
args.info: Identifier used by third-party specifed in domain, which we will attempt to match against our events listings. eventId is the id of an event, participantId is the id of a participant, like a band or sports team.

blocks.name: getEventCategories
blocks.description: Returns a hierarchical list of categories applied to events.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

blocks.name: getUserManagedPages
blocks.description: Returns an array of the pages a user manages.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

blocks.name: addPage
blocks.description: Allows users to create a new page. The creating user is added as a manager of the new page.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: name
args.info: The name of the page

blocks.name: getPageVenuesTimeSeriesData
blocks.description: Get daily venue stats for venues managed by a page over a time range.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: pageId
args.info: The page whose venues to get timeseries data for

args.name: startAt
args.info: The start of the time range to retrieve stats for (seconds since epoch).

args.name: endAt
args.info: The end of the time range to retrieve stats for (seconds since epoch). If omitted, the current time is assumed.

args.name: fields
args.info: Specifies which fields to return. May be one or more of totalCheckins, newCheckins, uniqueVisitors, sharing, genders, ages, hours, separated by commas.

blocks.name: getPageAccessToken
blocks.description: Returns an OAuth access token for the specified page. The requesting user must be a manager of the page.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: userId
args.info: The page you want similar pages for.

blocks.name: getPageVenues
blocks.description: Allows you to get the page's venues.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Application client id.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: Application client secret key.

args.name: pageId
args.info: The page whose venues to get venues for

args.name: location
args.info: Not valid with ne or sw. Limits results to venues near this latitude and longitude within an optional radius.

args.name: radius
args.info: Can be used when including ll. Not valid with ne or sw. Limit results to venues within this many meters of the specified ll. The maximum supported radius is currently 100,000 meters.

args.name: southWest
args.info: Example: `44.3,37.2`. With northEast, limits results to the bounding quadrangle defined by the latitude and longitude given by sw as its south-west corner, and ne as its north-east corner. The bounding quadrangle is only supported for intent=browse searches. Not valid with ll or radius. Bounding quadrangles with an area up to approximately 10,000 square kilometers are supported.

args.name: northEast
args.info: See `southWest`.

args.name: offset
args.info: The offset of which venues to return. Defaults to 0.

args.name: limit
args.info: The number of venues to return. Defaults to 20, max of 100.

args.name: storeId
args.info: Only return venues whose storeId matches. storeIds are defined by the page manager (and therefore namespaced to that particular page). They are the page's own internal identifier for that venue. *Cannot be used with any geo params*.

blocks.name: getSinglePageUpdate
blocks.description: Get page update details.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: updateId
args.info: The ID of the update to retrieve additional information for.

args.name: limit
args.info: The number of nearby venues to show (default 20).

args.name: location
args.info: The location of the current user.

blocks.name: getPageUpdates
blocks.description: Returns a list of page updates created by the current user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

blocks.name: likePageUpdate
blocks.description: Causes the current user to 'like' a page update. If there is a campaign associated with the update, the like will propagate to the special as well.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access Token obtained from Foursquare OAuth.

args.name: updateId
args.info: The ID of the update to like.
